website_summaries.verdict: An inexpensive option that is most noted for its ease of use.
pros: Work contact element prevents accidental fires
Non-marring tip protects work surface from scratches
cons: The placement of the safety makes it difficult to use in tight areas
While jamming isn't a huge problem, when it occurs it can be difficult to clear

customer_reviews.title: Small stapler with a big oooomph. Great value, you will not be disappointed.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this been a little skeptical. I was completely wrong. I have a screened in porch and because of high wind and cats I have to replace 12 mesh screens. I wen to home depot and purchased the staples I needed and set about replacing the screens. Let me say that the stapler worked fantastic, never jammed and went deep into the wood securing the mesh every time. I kid you not. Not one misfire or jam. You will not be disappointing and worth every penny for the money. Great value.
customer_reviews.author: Ciaran A. O'brien

customer_reviews.title: I'm a DIYer and needed something fast and less painful than a hand stabler to upholstery my bed and ...
customer_reviews.text: I'm a DIYer and needed something fast and less painful than a hand stabler to upholstery my bed and headboard. I've never used another staple gun before so I don't have anything to compare this with but I can't imagine needing a different one. Easy to operate and worked flawlessly. Loved the price on this. I'd buy another one in a heartbeat.
customer_reviews.author: Kyllan

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Staple Gun !!!
customer_reviews.text: This is an awesome stapler. Don't settle for a cheaper one. I used 1/2" staples in treated plywood for over 2000 staples, Worked flawlessly !!! Recovered my boat seats and the inside upholstery. Then recovered my golf cart seats too. Now I'm ready to do my friends golf cart also...I used the T-50 stainless steel staples bought here on Amazon.Com. Worked better than explained. Just buy the T-50 compatible staples and you'll be fine!!! Just Buy This, If You Have An Air Compressor !!!!
customer_reviews.author: Clay Ledkins

customer_reviews.title: Quality stapler with enough punch for most upholstery work. Trouble free use.
customer_reviews.text: A. Fine stapler for most light duty upholstery jobs and such. I bought it to install pressed tin ceiling in a commercial application. It worked fine on the tin but the staples. Weren't strong enough to go. Thru 2 layers so I had to resort to my narrow crown staplerbut this stapler has. Been used to reupholstered my kitchen chairs flawlessly.
customer_reviews.author: pgciboss

customer_reviews.title: Works, but the "safety" is always in the way.
customer_reviews.text: Works well, but the "safety" makes it very difficult to use. Notice how far it sticks out from the stapler, makes it impossible to get into tight areas. So I removed it and now it works pretty good. It tends to jam and is very difficult to get unjammed in some cases, but I suppose all staplers are difficult to clear.
customer_reviews.author: D. Joyce

customer_reviews.title: Worked as advertised
customer_reviews.text: This staple gun is light and very easy to use. After purchasing an electric staple gun and returning it shortly afterwards. I researched and came across this one and I am so glad I did. I used it to install the screen on my porch. Worked each and every time. It never jammed on me and made screening in my porch very easy. The only drawback for some is that a compressor is required. By the way, a compressor is a good investment.
customer_reviews.author: J. Pena

customer_reviews.title: So far it's been great. Running it on 90psi no problem
customer_reviews.text: What a deal. So far it's been great. Running it on 90psi is no problem. In fact I ran 1.5 sticks of staples running off just a 3 gallon air tank. Started with 125psi ended with just under 90 on the guage. Right at the end you could feel it was having a little trouble driving the staples, but anything over 90 psi was just fine. Well worth the money. It drove 3/8" staples thru premium artificial grass into 3/4" OSB with no problems. (I should have used 1/2" but the 3/8" did the job. Don't ask why I'm stapling fake grass to 4x8 sheets of OSB, it's a long and crazy story.)
customer_reviews.author: Stickman

customer_reviews.title: Great gun good price
customer_reviews.text: Used to recover jet ski seat. Started with electric gun. Staples went in as long as I really push down hard. Also Couldn't get to certain areas because of flat tip. Purchased this gun to get into those areas because it's tip was extended. Plus the price was less than my electric gun. Ended up using this gun for entire job because it's power and ease of use was so superior.
customer_reviews.author: woodman

customer_reviews.title: GREAT CUSTOMER SERVICE
customer_reviews.text: bought one a few weeks ago oiled it hooked it up and it did not work right , so i called customer service this was wednesday i talked with a veronica who was very nice and no problem. she had me a new one there by friday noon the other one is working great ! GREAT customer service would buy from them again
customer_reviews.author: country guy

customer_reviews.title: Perhaps the greatest fine-wire stapler on the planet. It works on everything from upholstery to garden lattice.
customer_reviews.text: Perhaps the greatest fine-wire stapler on the planet. It works on everything from upholstery to garden lattice. There's no safety tip to interfere with the stapling, therefore you can jam the point of the tool into double-bead welting in your upholstery work. Other pneumatic staplers - even those with a long snoot like this one - have safety extensions that make it impossible to use them for serioius upholstering.
customer_reviews.author: Novelist-in-Vegas

customer_reviews.title: Good little staple gun
customer_reviews.text: Used this for a boat upholstery job with SS staples. It doesn't like low pressures. Tried to get down to about 40 psi but the piston wouldn't return reliably. Had to run at 60 or above. That required me to hold the nose off the leather a little bit else it'd shoot right through. Otherwise it worked fantastic, especially for the price!!
customer_reviews.author: Aprimefan

customer_reviews.title: Excellent little stapler!!!
customer_reviews.text: Excellent little stapler!!! My wife used it to reupholster the seats and cushions in our boat, saving us thousands of $$$ and the stapler performed very well, pushing SS staples through thick marine vinyl and into a thick plastic frame with great ease and high reliability. We strongly recommend this product for similar project use.
customer_reviews.author: Avid Amazon User1111

customer_reviews.title: Replacing staples
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this stapler to make cornices for a friend and it was wonderful. I t was easy to use and so easy to add more staples as I worked. My only complaint was that it does not staple close to the corners, there is a 1/4 inch gap for the safety flange. I wo update s ef inatel y recommend it.r
customer_reviews.author: Linda McDonough

customer_reviews.title: Very good tool for my money
customer_reviews.text: This light weight but efficient tool is a time saver for my first upholstery renovation DIY home project. It is easy to use and can reach into tight corners to shoot a staple. I expended a whole box of staples and yet had never experienced any jamming.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel P. Yeh Tr

customer_reviews.title: misfires/hangs up constantly-would not buy
customer_reviews.text: When I first got this stapler it was fine, I oil it regularly along with all my other pneumatic nailers but after about a month it started hanging up-meaning it would misfire and not put a staple in probably every 15 trigger pulls.
customer_reviews.author: J

customer_reviews.title: Excellent value for your dollar.
customer_reviews.text: Great value for the dollar. I needed a staple gun to work off my air compressor and this was the best value I could find as I only needed it for one small job. I’m sure this will last for a very long time with light usage.
customer_reviews.author: Technotony

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Staple Gun
customer_reviews.text: This Freeman pneumatic staple gun is a great buy, I have a 12x24 shed/garage that I insulated using this stapler to attach the fiberglass insulation. This gun is light weight and easy to use I highly recommend this Item. This is the first time that I have given anything a 5 Star rating across the board as I did with this item.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The slug that hits the staple was sticking and blocked ...
customer_reviews.text: The slug that hits the staple was sticking and blocked the next staple feed. It would work for 1 or 2 staples and then shoot blanks. Returned the stapler!
customer_reviews.author: Don Martin

customer_reviews.title: Strong little stapler. T50, all sizes
customer_reviews.text: Dont hesitate on this one. It works great. Its fast, sturdy, strong too...sinks staples if you're not careful, and I accidentally ran a staple in to a metal door. It went through the metal as if it were wood.
customer_reviews.author: The drapers

customer_reviews.title: I love a product that works.
customer_reviews.text: I love a product that works. I have a project that is going to require a lot of staples. I have fired almost 1,000 staples and I am maybe 1/2 way done and this tool has done all that I asked without a whimper. Good tool.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Worked well, some air leakage at trigger but Freeman provided replacement.
customer_reviews.text: Straight from the box had some minor air leakage from trigger at all times. Otherwise, stapler worked well. 250+ staples driven to consistent depth. Update 5/4/19: contacted Freeman via their website. They responded quickly and sent me a new stapler free of charge. Excellent customer service. Bumping review 3->4 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Mark A.

customer_reviews.title: Not too expensive but works great
customer_reviews.text: I used this stapler connected to my air pump to install the new cover on my Yamaha Waverunner. The staples I used were only 1/4 inch stainless but I'm certain it will do well with longer staples as well.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Wayne S. Mergott Jr.

customer_reviews.title: Great Staple Gun
customer_reviews.text: Great tool for upholstering furniture. Worked each and every time and saved a lot of time versus the hand stapler. Well worth the investment.
customer_reviews.author: Lynne

customer_reviews.title: it works, and well priced
customer_reviews.text: it works, and well priced, So far only one thing....... it jammed .....1 time so far....... and it is tough to get the jammed staple out ... but put lots of staples through it and so far I'd say great tool..........
customer_reviews.author: G.P.WI

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: Great pneumatic stapler. Worked great for carpeting my boat decks. No way would I have used a hand stapler! Doesn’t use a lot of air either so a small compressor is fine for it.
customer_reviews.author: J-Rod

customer_reviews.title: This is a surprisingly good pneumatic stapler for the price
customer_reviews.text: This is a surprisingly good pneumatic stapler for the price.I tested it using a range of T50 staple size for furniture/upholstery projects (stapling a few different heavy duty fabrics into solid wood), and it never missed a beat. The belt hook is a handy detail that you don't see too often on staplers of this size.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Smith

customer_reviews.title: Freeman PFWS Pneumatic 20-Gauge 9/16" Fine Wire Stapler
customer_reviews.text: Light weight, comfortable to hold, easy to use. I used this staple gun to attach the bottoms of my dining room chairs that had been recently reupholstered. Using the staple gun with a small 3 gallon compressor set to 80psi the staples were applied with ease and took only a few minutes to complete. I would highly recommend this staple gun as it provides performance typically found in far more costly products.
customer_reviews.author: Clifford L. Plavin

customer_reviews.title: Beats what I had before hands down.
customer_reviews.text: Just upholstered 6 chair seats and the stapler worked fine. Unlike regular hand or electric staplers it drives the staples all the way in with no problem. It does fire quite a few "double strikes" but that is mostly operator error and improved with practice.
customer_reviews.author: Idaho Camper

customer_reviews.title: First one failed but replacement was fine.
customer_reviews.text: Not a five star due to return. I had to return the first one since I was only getting about a 50% success rate with staples. Amazon made the whole process painless with the exchange. The second one was MUCH better. It worked as I expected it to.
customer_reviews.author: Dean Fife

customer_reviews.title: Will jam on you
customer_reviews.text: Jammed on me the first use had to disassemble the thing to get the jam cleared couldn’t get it back together threw it away
customer_reviews.author: Clint Weber

customer_reviews.title: The grip is comfortable and light
customer_reviews.text: Professionally constructed and performs well. The grip is comfortable and light. Beats those out there that weighs heavily in your hands. Loading was a breeze and it fires smoothly and every staple was a clean shot. I own 2 other Freeman tools and I can say that they are very well constructed and a joy to use. Buy with confidence, it is a great tool.
customer_reviews.author: Francis S Heng

customer_reviews.title: Did my chairs with ease
customer_reviews.text: Once you attached to the air compressor it worked flawlessly. A bit of a learning curve to learn how much air is needes to use certain staples.
customer_reviews.author: J.M.

customer_reviews.title: Works every time.
customer_reviews.text: Worked great, does not hang up. Used it to secure screen wire on porch that was damaged during storm. Easy to use
customer_reviews.author: D J Long

customer_reviews.title: It uses T50 Aarow Brand staples
customer_reviews.text: I could not find anywhere on the listing where it said what staples it took other than 20 gauge, and the staples you buy dont list the gauge only the size. So as you can see the box says you can use Aarow T50 type staples.
customer_reviews.author: Drew

customer_reviews.title: Great brand, great price
customer_reviews.text: Great air stapler and works as designed. Great price too. I own other air guns from this company and I have not had any problem.
customer_reviews.author: Andy B

customer_reviews.title: Great buy!
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use, staples reliably, without glitches. Made short work of putting up some hardware cloth in our chicken coop!
customer_reviews.author: BigA

customer_reviews.title: Great Gun as long as you oil it
customer_reviews.text: Great gun for the price. Do use the supplied oil lube though, as it misfires without it.
customer_reviews.author: RickM

customer_reviews.title: Worked fine for 3-4 years then...
customer_reviews.text: Cast aluminum air chamber seems to have crumbled and finding bits/shavings have damaged the o-rings. l Was very pleased with it up to that point. I was very conscious about never exceeding the recommended air pressure and 4-5 times a year on light duty projects.
customer_reviews.author: SteveO

customer_reviews.title: Not real impressed, misfires a lot and hangs up ...
customer_reviews.text: Not real impressed, misfires a lot and hangs up. To many staples and it wont work at all. Have to put in half the amount in says it can handle.
customer_reviews.author: Troy

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: For 30 bucks you can't go wrong. I put about 500 staples through it right away. It will jam if not lubed.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellet stapler
customer_reviews.text: I'm building a 24' X 36' shop/garage fully insulated. This stapler was a life saver or maybe hand saver installing the insulation. I went thru over three thousand staples (3/8"). Outstanding tool.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: The hammer that presses the staples in got stuck at ...
customer_reviews.text: The hammer that presses the staples in got stuck at least 1 of every 7 times it was used. I had to return.
customer_reviews.author: MNOiSY

customer_reviews.title: It works very well
customer_reviews.text: Great little tool! I love it...very sturdy quick delivery and very good price! Very well made!
customer_reviews.author: Greg Solano

customer_reviews.title: That you need an air compressor to be able to use it!!
customer_reviews.text: I am trying to contact the seller, I want to return it or exchange for a electrical one, it is not electric, it requires an air compressor which I do plan or want to but just for a nail gun. I did not realize it wasn’t electric.
customer_reviews.author: Angela A. Poletti

customer_reviews.title: Better than electric
customer_reviews.text: My stapler needs are minor but I wanted an upgrade from the terrible electric staplers and this is a million times better than those.
customer_reviews.author: R.A.M.Top Contributor: Woodworking

customer_reviews.title: Really good product, just needs a little adjusting when you ...
customer_reviews.text: Really good product, just needs a little adjusting when you first get it. And I removed the safety to make it even better. The safety mechanism gets in the way of seeing where your staples are going. It is easily removable with a little modification. I used this for upholstery.
customer_reviews.author: Cp6685

customer_reviews.title: No misfires
customer_reviews.text: I love this stapler! Came quickly, worked perfectly with several different sizes of staples. Great price! Great product!
customer_reviews.author: Christy

customer_reviews.title: Wrks very well!
customer_reviews.text: Very happy with this one. Uses T50 staples and no problems at all!
customer_reviews.author: M. Leeber

customer_reviews.title: Great Value !
customer_reviews.text: Very nice fit and finish. Unit works very well on driving staples. Far superior to hand powered Stanley that I have used for many years.
customer_reviews.author: Just a Guy

customer_reviews.title: Good value and worked very well.
customer_reviews.text: I used it to install some staple installed insulation and this tool worked great. IT was vastly superior to using a hand compression tool and I had very little trouble with staples feeding. As long as I used the tool properly it worked properly for me. I would buy this one again.
customer_reviews.author: PGittins

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Quality, Amazing Price!
customer_reviews.text: Very surprised that for such a low price you can get an amazing quality stapler! Just what I was looking for - wish I had it last year for my other project! This is a very solid, well constructed tool - truly is a professional grade model. love it!!
customer_reviews.author: David T.

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use. I did have one jam but I am stapling metal vent screen. Wish I bought it long ago.
customer_reviews.author: Phantom Reviewer

customer_reviews.title: GREAT STAPLER!
customer_reviews.text: Used it to recover 4 kitchen chairs, worked great, easy to use, and beats using a hand stapler, and for $27 well worth the money and uses T50 staples! which you can get at the local hardware store.
customer_reviews.author: THOMAS MILLER

customer_reviews.title: Nailer Highly Recommend
customer_reviews.text: My husband loves the ease of this nailer. Our contractor used it and said I need to get myself one of these. So we got him one as a Thank You Gift. Highly Recommend
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Awesome stapler
customer_reviews.text: I needed to replace some carpet in my RV. Perfect tool, now to learn to upholstery!
customer_reviews.author: Grey

customer_reviews.title: Great Stapler
customer_reviews.text: I have been wanting a stapler like this for a long time. I used it on my upholstery project, worked great no sore hands from using a manual stapler. An added benefit is it uses common Arrow T50 staples.
customer_reviews.author: George

customer_reviews.title: Great seller and product
customer_reviews.text: Bought electric staple gun and read they all suck.. This sinks 1/2" ss staples all ther way into old hard lumber. Great made product and great seller. Fast ship and great price I am very pleased. Would buy another but I'm sure this will last a long time as it is made rugged
customer_reviews.author: Geno

customer_reviews.title: Got the jobs done!
customer_reviews.text: Granted I've only used it handful of times, but it feels solid and well built. It worked flawlessly for all of my projects and is so easy and so much fun to use! I can't see why anyone using it for hobbies would need to pay more than this.
customer_reviews.author: Megan H

customer_reviews.title: Awesome tool. Lightweight
customer_reviews.text: Awesome tool. Lightweight, easy to handle, staples load easily and uses a nice variety of staple lengths using the T50 Staples.
customer_reviews.author: John Powers

customer_reviews.title: seems to work great. can let you know I a year from ...
customer_reviews.text: only used one time, seems to work great. can let you know I a year from now.
customer_reviews.author: steve berry

customer_reviews.title: Good reliable stapler
customer_reviews.text: Used the tool for a large project without any issues. Would recommend if you need a nice pneumatic stapler without breaking the bank.
customer_reviews.author: G. Jenkins

customer_reviews.title: It works really good but the only problem I've had is that sometimes ...
customer_reviews.text: It works really good but the only problem I've had is that sometimes I have to press a bit hard into the work piece for it to fire. Seems like the lock mechanism gets stuck.
customer_reviews.author: marco a garza

customer_reviews.title: this stapler worked great! The only thing that needs improvement are the ...
customer_reviews.text: Once I figured where to load the staples, this stapler worked great! The only thing that needs improvement are the instructions for use. They are cryptic and hard to understand. I had to rewrite the sequence of starting and stopping for myself in order to have a quick guide.
customer_reviews.author: Carol M.

customer_reviews.title: Works as advertised
customer_reviews.text: Putting up insulation in my basement, works perfectly! Misses every once in a while, could be because I got cheap staples!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great bang for your buck!
customer_reviews.text: I use this for building cabinets specifically for putting on the backs. Great bang for your buck. Would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Christian tierno

customer_reviews.title: Awesome gun!!
customer_reviews.text: Awesome staple gun! Amazing value! Re upholstered 9 boat seats never jammed used several thousand staples!
customer_reviews.author: Ke-in

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: DOES NOT use the fine upholstery staples. Uses standard staples only
customer_reviews.author: dokey

customer_reviews.title: Worth the money
customer_reviews.text: This gun saves time and money. I have other Freeman air tools and find them to be of good value for the money. Make sure to set the air pressure correctly and you are good to go. The warranty is great and so is the customer service.
customer_reviews.author: Katelyn Green

customer_reviews.title: Great Stapler
customer_reviews.text: I am very pleased with this stapler. I considered buying a Harbor Freight or a Porter Cable but I am happy I decided on this one. Vey high quality and the feel is much nicer than the others. Performed excellent.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick Behan

customer_reviews.title: and was far superior to three different electric staplers that I had previously ...
customer_reviews.text: Stapler was used to replace the screening on a 3 season room. Used in conjunction with a pancake compressor it worked flawlessly. Never jammed, and was far superior to three different electric staplers that I had previously tried.

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Jammed in first 5 minutes after that worked great for 20 hours wish it had a larger capacity

customer_reviews.title: Light and working fine, so far.
customer_reviews.text: Stapler is working great so far. It feeds well, with no jams, and is light and easy to get into tight places. I am using Stanley SS staples.
customer_reviews.author: Larry Lee

customer_reviews.title: nice, light, works great
customer_reviews.text: Light weight, easy to use, only had one jam in 4 hours of work. Only had one problem, the allen screw heads are soft and they installed them too tight. My first attempt to clear a jam resulted in stripped screw heads.

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: A great tool. We've put it to heavy use and it continues to work flawlessly.

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Works exactly as described. Made me more efficient on my upholstery jobs.

customer_reviews.title: Worked great.
customer_reviews.text: Rebuilt my boat trailer bunks and used this stapler. Also used the monel staples and drove over 500 without one jam or misfire. I hate to think how hard this job would have been with my manual Arrow staple gun.

customer_reviews.title: I used only one time and works correctly.
customer_reviews.text: Arrived on time but not have much experience with this tool for recommended.

customer_reviews.text: It’s worked perfectly for upholstering my couch. I love it!

customer_reviews.title: A great staple gun
customer_reviews.text: I have used this stapler on multiple projects for over a year now and it's a great product. Works now as it did when firing the first staple. I have not yet had the first staple jam (knock on wood :). It is also relatively quiet for a pneumatic stapler.

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this product for a couple of light upholstery projects, and it has performed well.

customer_reviews.text: Really impressed with this stapler. We assembled valences for our RV and this little stapler made the job so much easier. It never failed. For the money this is an excellent tool.

customer_reviews.title: Worked GREAT for me!
customer_reviews.text: Worked perfectly to recover my motorcycle seat. The long nose on it made it perfect to get staples down in the grooves. I played with the pressure on my compressor and put some staples in a spare 2x4 to get the pressure to what appeared to be right to me and then completely recovered the seat on my motorcycle in about 15 minutes. It worked flawlessly.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent quality. I reupholstered 8 dining chairs and the ...
customer_reviews.text: Excellent quality. I reupholstered 8 dining chairs and the gun did not jam once. T50 staples worked just fine.
customer_reviews.author: DB

customer_reviews.title: I hated the safety not rocket science to disable
customer_reviews.text: No jamming yet. I hated the safety not rocket science to disable.
customer_reviews.author: Coolin

customer_reviews.title: just fee whole or single staple strips into it, avoid feeding multiple "smaller" strip pieces into it.
customer_reviews.text: Works really well, but got jammed really badly when using multiple broken up pieces of full strips, which I think it should be able to handle, but something jammed up, and I had to disassemble 80% of the gun to release the jammed staple, but after reassembly it works just fine......I won't be using separate smaller staple strips together anymore, I'll just load the pieces one at a time and reload the next smaller piece, rather than risk the terrible jam I got from using multiple smaller strip pieces simultaneously.
customer_reviews.author: Paul R DesRoches

customer_reviews.title: Easy to load and easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Makes the job much easier than manual staplers. Easy to load and easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: Donna Kempe

product_meta.title: Freeman PFWS Pneumatic 20-Gauge 9/16" Fine Wire Stapler Ergonomic and Lightweight Nail Gun with No Mar Tip For Screens, Upholstery, and Crafts
product_meta.description: The Freeman PFWS Pneumatic 20-Gauge 9/16" Fine Wire Stapler is perfect for insulation, upholstery, screen work, picture frames, as well as hobbies and crafts. This air powered staple gun is compatible with 20 gauge fine wire staples from 1/4" to 9/16", and is equipped with an easy to reload rear loading magazine capable of holding 100 fasteners. The magazine and cylinder are constructed of anodized aluminum for lightweight durability, and the Teflon O-rings and one piece drive blade work to extend the life of the tool. The ergonomically designed die cast aluminum body results in a lightweight and rugged tool great for use over long shifts, and the comfort grip handle reduces fatigue while increasing control and accuracy of staple placement. A no mar safety tip prevents damage to your working surface, and the 360 degree adjustable exhaust easily directs air away from your face. This staple gun will ensure fast and professional results for DIYers working on home improvement and repair projects and contractors at the job site. The Pneumatic 20-Gauge 9/16" Fine Wire Stapler includes a belt hook, safety goggles, air tool oil, and adjustment tools.
feature_bullets: Nailed It: This pneumatic fine wire stapler features a lightweight and durable aluminum body, ergonomic comfort grip handle, and no mar tip to prevent scratches and dents to your work surface. It's ideal for upholstery, screens, crafts, insulation, and roofing felt.

Many Applications: This stapler is perfect for a wide variety of home and professional applications from securing roofing to fixing a gap in upholstery. It features an ergonomically engineered body and 360 degree adjustable exhaust allow for comfortable use.

The Right Tool for the Job: We're committed to providing outstanding value, top tier customer service and long lasting, high quality products. We make nailers and staplers for every purpose, from roofing to siding to flooring and everything in between.

Quality and Durability: We manufacture tools with the most durable materials under strict quality control guidelines, suitable for professional contractors and do-it-yourselfers alike. Our tools are sold, distributed, serviced, and warrantied in the USA.

Tough and Dependable: We make an array of durable construction tools and accessories, including staplers and nailers for siding, flooring, framing, finish, and roofing. Compare our products to similar items by Makita, Hitachi, Bostitch, Senco, Paslode, and Dewalt.
